jobDescription: Job Description As the Data Scientist Senior Manager, you will be responsible for the development and implementation of proprietary machine learning algorithms and techniques to solve business problems and optimize our member experience. In this role, you must proactively collaborate with business partners to develop actionable plans to enable the identification of patterns related to claim quality, cost, and other variables. Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Working with data sets of varying degrees of size and complexity, including both structured and unstructured data.Implementing real-time model scoring to drive actions.Determine continuous improvement opportunities of current predictive modeling algorithms.Mentor, guide, and develop Data Scientists and Analysts within the team. The successful Data Scientist Senior Manager will possess excellent analytical and problem solving skills, with a strong attention to detail and accuracy. You will also demonstrate excellent written and oral communication skills, along with superior organization skills. You must be adaptable and able to move with change, while maintaining positivity and being a strong role model on the team. You should be able to handle multiple tasks and adapt to evolving business and technical environments. The contributions you will make as the Data Scientist Senior Manager will help to position CVS Health as a leader in client satisfaction and service within the PBM marketplace.  This role can be located in any one of our major hubs in Northbrook, IL, Irving, TX, Scottsdale, AZ, or Woonsocket, RI, as well as remote/telecommute with ability to travel 10%-15%.  Required Qualifications 5+ years of experience in predictive analytics or equivalent, including theoretical and practical experience with various machine learning techniques and statistical algorithms.3+ years of advanced expertise with software such as Python, R, or SAS, with demonstrated ability in manipulating data and drawing insights from data sets.3+ years of intermediate-advanced knowledge using Hive, impala, or Apache Spark, as well as data extraction and manipulation using SQL.3+ years of experience working with distributed computing environments such as Hadoop.3+ years of demonstrated experience leading and delivering projects. Preferred Qualifications PBM experience/healthcare industry experience.Experience with data forensics.Education Bachelor's degree in Statistics,  Mathematics, Computer Science, or related quantitative field. MA/MS is preferred.  Business Overview  CVS Health, through our unmatched breadth of service offerings, is transforming the delivery of health care services in the U.S. We are an innovative, fast-growing company guided by values that focus on teamwork, integrity and respect for our colleagues and customers. What are we looking for in our colleagues? We seek fresh ideas, new perspectives, a diversity of experiences, and a dedication to service that will help us better meet the needs of the many people and businesses that rely on us each day. As the nations largest pharmacy health care provider, we offer a wide range of exciting and fulfilling career opportunities across our three business units MinuteClinic, pharmacy benefit management (PBM) and retail pharmacy. Our energetic and service-oriented colleagues work hard every day to make a positive difference in the lives of our customers.  CVS Health is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or employment against any individual on the basis of race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, religion, sex/gender (including pregnancy), national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, physical or mental disability, medical condition, age, veteran status, military status, marital status, genetic information, citizenship status, unemployment status, political affiliation, or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state or local law. CVS Health will consider qualified job candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with federal, state and local laws. CVS Health will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against any Colleague or applicant for employment because such Colleague or applicant has inquired about, discussed, or disclosed the compensation of the Colleague or applicant or another Colleague or applicant. Furthermore, we comply with the laws and regulations set forth in the following EEO is the Law Poster: EEO IS THE LAW and EEO IS THE LAW SUPPLEMENT  Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require assistance to apply for this job, please contact us by clicking EEO AA CVS Health  CVS Health does not require nor expect that applicants disclose their compensation history during the application, interview, and hiring process.  For inquiries related to the application process or technical issues please contact the Kenexa Helpdesk at 1-855-338-5609. For technical issues with the Virtual Job Tryout assessment, contact the Shaker Help Desk at 1-877-987-5352. Please note that we only accept resumes via our corporate website: https://jobs.cvshealth.com/
